intro: Maieta scalpta, commonly known as the scalped maieta, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are small and pale green, typically appearing in clusters at the top of the plant. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, Maieta scalpta is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
